title: Wife of missing pilot David Stephens says situation heartbreaking
description: David Stephens wife says he had the plane recently inspected before he disappeared while flying over the NSW Snowy Mountains en route from Wangaratta in Victoria to Moruya on the NSW south coast.

title: Live Dolphins and Cowboys clash in vital Queensland derby
description: The Dolphins and Cowboys are both outside the top eight, and are coming off losses last weekend. A loss this evening will make their quest for the finals harder as September fast approaches. Follow live.

title: Flu cases spike in WA amid horror July influenza season
description: The Australian Medical Association fears WA is in the midst of one of the states worst flu seasons as cases soar and vaccination rates dwindle.

title: Double murderer who killed victims with meat cleaver may be released
description: Scott Alexander McDougall became the first convicted murderer in the ACT more than a decade when he was found guilty of murdering two people.

title: America didnt just watch Albaneses China trip, it sought to shape it
description: Theatrics and symbolism aside, the trip served as a reminder of the extent to which Australia has returned to Chinas good books.

title: How experts say Trump set his own trap on the Epstein files
description: Donald Trumps derision of some supporters as weaklings is the latest spray in an ongoing attempt to shift the public conversation past calls for the full release of files linked to the Jeffrey Epstein case. Experts say his approach could fall flat with some of his most fervent supporters.

title: Man jailed for six years for fatal assault outside Darwin shopping centre
description: Joseph Wunungmurra, 39, been sentenced for his role in a fatal assault on a man outside the Rapid Creek shopping centre in 2023.

title: New chapter in story of a man who was once a protégé of Gough Whitlam
description: He once had a chance at the top job in the nation  now Mark Latham is defending himself against allegations of domestic abuse and being involved in a sex tape in his NSW parliamentary office.

title: Judge scathing of ADFA in sentencing former cadet for rape of colleague
description: Former ADFA cadet Angus Robertson is sentenced to almost two years in jail for raping a fellow cadet in her academy room, after the victim told him she would go no further than kissing.

title: Indonesian police bust baby-trafficking ring that allegedly sold 24 infants
description: At least 13 suspects linked to an alleged baby-trafficking ring, which Indonesian police say sold at least 24 infants overseas, have been arrested.

title: What is mitochondrial donation and why is it called three-person IVF?
description: Researchers in the United Kingdom have announced the successful birth of eight babies after a clinical trial of an IVF technique known as mitochondrial donation.

title: MP Gareth Wards alleged assaults not a coincidence, court hears
description: Prosecutors say two complainants, unknown to each other, who gave strikingly similar accounts of alleged assaults by NSW MP Gareth Ward, is evidence they are telling the truth.

title: Wife of slain Sunshine Coast man says he was her entire world
description: Gry Tømte has written an emotional tribute to her husband, who was allegedly stabbed during a botched break and enter on Sunday night.

title: Loitering charge dropped against neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell over Australia Day march
description: A charge has been dropped against neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell over a march through the Adelaide CBD on Australia Day.

title: Footballer may have been thrown from ute and fatally injured, court hears
description: Several witnesses have told the inquest into Brady Hubbards death three West Ulverstone Football Club members lied to others at the club and covered up how he was injured. Those three men have now given evidence.

title: Russian mum, daughters found living in Indian cave after overstaying visa
description: Indian authorities claim 40-year-old Nina Kutina had been living in the cave in the countrys south for more than a week, and say she told police she was interested in staying in the forest and worshipping God.

title: 27-year study of outback reserve offers glimpse into pre-colonial times
description: Conservationists have offered surprising insights into what small mammal colonies may have looked like before Europeans arrived in Australia.

title: Wallabies bolter to make Test debut in British and Irish Lions opener
description: Flanker Nick Champion de Crespigny will debut for the Wallabies in their British and Irish Lions series opener while Will Skelton has missed selection.

title: David Speirss mind went to dark and scary places ahead of Kokoda hike
description: Three months after former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs was convicted and fined over drug supply charges, he has detailed his plans to hike the Kokoda Track on a personal journey of restoration and renewal.

title: Pedro Pascal is now Marvels Daddy in The Fantastic Four First Steps
description: The latest Marvel offering is another blockbuster but the off-screen chemistry of its cast reveals how they found the family at the movies heart.

title: Law firm investigates alleged historical sex abuse at Perth primary school
description: The case is being brought on by a former student at Beldon Primary School, and lawyers want to speak with anyone who attend the school between 1990 and 1994.

title: Bank executive charged with procuring under-age girls for sex found dead
description: A Commonwealth Bank executive charged with procuring under-age girls for sex has been found dead in the Gold Coast hinterland, police have confirmed.

title: Minister approves split to undo NSW council merger disaster
description: The New South Wales government approves the separation of Cootamundra-Gundagai Regional Council, the first demerger of the 44 councils that were forcibly amalgamated in 2016.

title: Why chocolate could get even more expensive
description: A cocoa shortage means the price of chocolate has gone up. Experts explain why this is happening and how long its expected to last.

title: Albanese joins long list of world leaders to visit Great Wall
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has followed in the footsteps of many other world leaders by visiting the Great Wall of China. Heres a look back at some of the leaders who have walked along the ancient landmark.
